title: Packaging legislation taking hold in US - BakingBusiness.com
summary: Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR) legislation is gaining momentum in the US, requiring companies to pay fees for packaging disposal. These bills are complex and lack uniformity, causing uncertainty for companies. Industry advocates are seeking more control over these programs and support for sustainable packaging solutions.

title: US plastics recycling rebounds from pandemic lows - Plastics Recycling Update
summary: The U.S. plastic bottle recycling rate rose slightly in 2021, driven by PET bottles. The report shows an increase in total plastic recovered, indicating a bounceback from pandemic-related dips. Industry leaders emphasize the need for public policy to drive systemic change, improve collection and sortation, and stabilize demand for recycled resins.

title: Chile's Atacama Desert has become a fast fashion dumping ground - National Geographic
summary: Chile has become a dumping ground for unwanted clothing from around the world, with millions of tons arriving annually at its duty-free port in Iquique. The influx of discarded clothes, often labelled as 'fast fashion', is a consequence of globalization, trade, and rapidly changing fashion trends. This phenomenon, dubbed the 'great fashion garbage patch', has raised concerns about the environmental impact of textile waste and the need for more sustainable practices within the fashion industry.

title: How yachts are disposed of â€“ and why it's so environmentally toxic - Yachting Monthly
summary: The marine industry is facing a growing problem of disposing of fiberglass (GRP) boats at the end of their lifespan. While GRP has been a successful material for boatbuilding, its durability makes recycling difficult. The article explores various recycling technologies and the challenges of scaling them up, highlighting the need for collaboration and innovative uses for recycled GRP.

title: Compactor presses proving useful to manage on-farm used silage and bale wrap plastics - Alberta Beef Producers - ABP Daily
summary: Alberta farmers are facing challenges with disposing of used silage and bale wrap plastics.  A new pilot program provides compactors to densify the plastic waste, making it easier to transport and recycle. The program, funded by the Canadian government, aims to promote agricultural sustainability by recycling plastic into new products.
